page.title: 10Woodland And Footpath
page.content: Magpie wood is a small private woodland, once part of one large woodland area together with Stainton Little Wood, owned by Mr.J.C.Raper of Wilsic Lodge Farm. It comprises of mainly sycamore, ash and young elm trees, a few evergreens with beech and hawthorn at the edges. It is overgrown with brambles and bracken. There is a small variety of common flowers-red campion, pignut, bluebell, speedwell, nettles. Magpies and swifts nest nearby. Insects seen-slugs, ladybirds, woodlice, spiders. The Braithwell area has many well-used footpaths and bridleways linking the villages. One is known locally as Granny Grindle's lane. A most picturesque walk across the fields to Clifton (Highest Point) and Micklebring is a treat not to be missed.
